titles: An elegie on that incomparable example of hospitality, charity, and generosity, the thrice-worthy William Whitmore, Esq; who departed this life on the fifth of this instant August, 1678.
notes: Verse: "GReat Whitmore! though I never drank thy Wine ..."
Within mourning borders, with emblems and motto.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Whitmore, William, d. 1678 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
